website_summaries.verdict: A bevy of features and a efficient fan make this recumbent bike a pleasure to exercise with.
pros: The back of the bike seat is ventilated to help with air circulation and enhance rider comfort
A convenient drink holder makes hydrating simple
The bike's durable construction is backed by a solid warranty
cons: Speakers are not the greatest quality and the control panel may be a bit complicated for some

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sturdy machine
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great except for the adjustiing for shorter people. This happens on all recumbent bikes. If someone is short and has problems with knees and hips, the person may not be able to cycle a full rotation wiith the seat all the way down in front. I'm going to replace the pedals with adaptive pedals and that should help. Other than that, the assembler was great and the price for Nautilus was good. It's super sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Vikinggirl58

customer_reviews.title: The machine is excellent. The company is marginal
customer_reviews.text: The bike was exactly as advertised and gets lots of use every day. The company, however, was less than customer friendly. The machine arrived missing one small, inexpensive part. It took two phone calls and every bit of identification I could proved to finally receive the part almost a month after my first phone call. The machine is excellent. The company is marginal.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working less than two months in
customer_reviews.text: Had the bike for less than 2 months and now it doesn't register that I'm pedaling. 5 seconds after starting a workout the bike pauses the workout and then turns off. The manual states that a wire or sensor may be faulty. Really annoying that a brand new piece of equipment is now not usable, 2 days after the return window ends. Wish me luck getting this fixed. Maybe by the end of Winter I'll have it fixed or replaced. Either way I now have to spend probably hours getting it serviced while not being able to use my brand new bike. Buyer beware. Maybe I got unlucky, maybe I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Choose Something Else
customer_reviews.text: This bike's computer system only worked for about 2 or 3 weeks. We called the company to explain the problem and they sent out parts for us to fix. We fixed it, and it worked again for about 2 to 3 weeks. Now it will run for 5 seconds, and then the timer freezes as if I'm not pedaling, and then the machine shuts down a few minutes later. I have to restart it 20 times to get an hour workout!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon's Ralph Nader

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This bike arrived 4/5/2020 and worked well for about 10 days when it started making a terrible clanking noise from the drive area. It continually got worse until I just stopped using it about 5 weeks ago. I have tried multiple times by telephone and email to reach Nautilus and have not been able to contact them. The last time today the phone system said my expected wait time was 96 minutes. I have received no response from the contact by email form on their website after submitting four times. I went to the BBB site and they have many complaints for not responding to customers.
customer_reviews.author: mah817

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal bike. No issues everything works as advertised. I would buy this again. I highly recommend! After owning this for a year it is still absolutely phenomenal. Still no issues, would buy it again and still highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding this for over 2 months now and I love it. The screen is great. The fan is not enough so I still have a regular fan blowing on me. The seat back leans back a little too far so I have to use a pillow to sit up straight more. I really haven't used many of the features to be honest. However I do get a good workout on level 7 so I have no major complaints. Previous cheaper bikes only last me a year or so but hoping this will go 3 or more years for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING 1 MONTH AFTER I COULDN’T RETURN IT.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap garbage. I bought this under the impression that Nautilus’s reputation in commercial gym equipment would translate. It doesn’t. Not only is the cheap plastic seat ridiculously uncomfortable but, two months after I bought it and one month after the return window, the console stopped receiving signal from the pedals so now it’s just a giant, $400 eyesore sitting in my living room that I’ll have to find some way to dispose of now as well. I’m really not the type to write reviews at all, but this is just unacceptable. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo Slice

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, the box it was shipped in was in very poor shape. I took an inventory and surprisingly it was all there. Assembly was easy by following the instructions step by step. We have been using it for about four weeks and it is great. Everything is working as advertised and we are very pleased. Hopefully it will be as durable as we expect. We had looked at the model 614 and 616 but we are very happy that we selected the model 618 for the extra features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, a very disappointing unit: 1. Totally uncomfortable seat and back rest, 2. Back rest adjusting lever does not work (checked installation several times), the back rest will not hold in any position, 3. No music streaming through Bluetooth, very annoying and very cheap not to offer this simple function on an EXPENSIVE unit, 4. Programs lack more functionality and settings. 5. Heart rate strap very cheap, won’t work, 6. Absolutely useless iPhone app you use for NOTHING! Does not sync your data or settings to the app! Overall this is a cheap unit I would have returned in an hour had I not shipped it overseas! Stay away and find a better model without these shortfalls.
customer_reviews.author: AmmarMalhas

customer_reviews.title: Product came damaged coustomer service was good.
customer_reviews.text: Product came damaged. It was not two day shipping even though it’s advertised as prime. I waisted a day waiting around for the package and it came two additional days later. Called coustomer service and they were helpful. However I felt like I waisted time chatting on the phone with them when the bike should have came in good condition to start. I’m 5 feet tall and the bike fits with room to spare. The setup was easy enough. I think the bike is comfortable my tall husband says the seat is not. The bike seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Just another reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Received the bike and had s no chrge assembly. Bike is ridiculously hard to pedal and resistance is at the lowest setting. Resistance control on the left handle doesn’t work. Seat adjustment is difficult to operate. Called Nautilus and the wanted to send a special tool to remove a part and attempt to repair the resistance. No thanks I’m sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ol Bob

customer_reviews.title: Your bad, Nautilus
customer_reviews.text: The first shipment, the box was totally trashed. Sent it back and ordered #2. That carton came in totally trashed, parts falling out of the box. Sent it back and ordered #3. The carton was beyond trashed. The box had burst open in two places and was held together by straps. Are you kidding me?? I give up and will go find something else. Other reviews say the bike itself is petty much a loser. Your bad, Nautilus.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable to your own needs
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and get started on. The seat is able to be moved to any position you want which makes it easy to change when others want to use it. Can go with the simple program of your own or use the pre-sets. The center bar is flat on the floor so you don't have to worry about getting snagged trying to get off the bike either. Took a bit to figure out how to use the heart monitor as there aren't really any instructions on running the programs, but it comes in handy if you're looking to push your cardio. Overall a great home exercise bike for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Branta

customer_reviews.title: Still not working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September and began to assemble 3-4 weeks later. Once assembled, it did not work. It was too late to return, I called them and they sent a person to repair it. He came 3 weeks later and could not fix it. They ordered more parts and can't come for another 3-4 weeks. It will be almost 2 months before I "may" be able to use the bike. Their customer service is good but very slow. When they come in December, they may or may not be able to fix the bike. If not, they will replace the bike but I will not have had my brand new bike for months. Beware...
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortuately buying a bike through the mail is always tough because you can't try it out. Once you open it and put it together you are stuck because you can never get it back into the box. Had I to do it over I would not buy a recumbent. It is awkard even with cushions. The bike I purchased started making a clunking sound after about a month. The company was very good about sending out a repair man who found a part that had moved during shipment. Easy fix but still an inconvenience. Next time I will buy exercise equipment in a store where I can try it out to get the best piece of equipment for me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. My wife and I put it together. It took a while, but not because it is complicated. It is easy to assemble. We just are not able to do what we once could do. Set up is easy and so is adjusting to fit. I am ramping up slowly and am seeing the results I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Product was defective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and put the exercise bicycle together, following all the instructions. The lowest resistance level was higher than any resistance I have ever experienced on any other exercise cycle. I called the factory representative and they said there was nothing they could do. I returned it and purchased another brand, with a better reputation, from a local source.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McLean

customer_reviews.title: ... of my exercise outside right now however I am pleased with the equipment
customer_reviews.text: Doing most of my exercise outside right now however I am pleased with the equipment. Allows me to exercise during inclement weather and when I just want to sit and watch evening programs or movies
customer_reviews.author: Don G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived on time and was not horrible to assemble. A week after receiving it a click could be heard when peddling. Parts were shipped to me and a technician made a weekend visit to repair the bike. Wrong part was delivered and the tech had to tear more of the bike apart to fix the tension bearing. Now the pedals feel a little sloppy. I spent a good amount of money to get a quality machine and do not feel like the value was there.
customer_reviews.author: QuackAddict82

customer_reviews.title: Great for users with back issues
customer_reviews.text: This recumbent bike is very smooth, easy to use,and has many optional workouts to choose. The heart rate sensors in the handles don't work very well but if you order the recommended chest strap monitor the problem is solved and the heart rate becomes very reliable. I have a bad back and I love this machine because I get a great workout without any back pain. I had to give up my treadmill because it was causing my back issues to get much worse. No my back is better than it has been in years.
customer_reviews.author: TimmyO

customer_reviews.title: Seat is difficult to adjust. No customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this exercise bike when the Covid lockdown began in CA. It was lost and it took several phone calls and two weeks to receive. Assembly was straightforward, with stuffing the wiring harness into the console column requiring my wife's help. The seat uses a cam to secure in position, and it's too difficult for my wife to do. Even then, if you lean forward, the seat moves out of position. The console saves 7 day and 30 day data, but these always match, even after 90 days. I've tried to reach customer care by email and phone with no luck. Bike seems durable, though, but I'm going with 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weathersby

customer_reviews.title: Bike stopped working and Support non responsive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike in October of 2019 to help with recovery from Hip Surgery. The Bike has been barely used and it has stopped working. We are getting error codes on pedaling and it stops after 5 seconds. We have followed the troubleshooting meticulously, to no avail. I have sent in two request, to support. So far no response. I tried to call and while hold was told it will be 125 minutes to answer!! This situation is unacceptable. I would be happy to change this review once it is resolved. This is terrible customer service and I am having an awful customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Next time a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: The heart beat monitor does not work. Screws and nuts began falling off a week after it was assembled by the assigned assembler. Otherwise it performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey bailey

customer_reviews.title: It's junk!
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about six months, then i started to hear odd noises, then a bearing seized. I replaced both of the cheap bearings with decent ones, then the RPM sensor failed. The whole thing is manufactured and assembled cheaply and poorly. Component quality is zero.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Try a different bike
customer_reviews.text: Programs/console very confusing; no instruction manual included (available online); heart rate monitor fails repeatedly; too small if you're over 6 feet (I just fit); pedal straps too small for big feet (ditto); a "clunking" sound and feel on some programs; seat smalller than one would like; water bottle holder not in reach while riding (it's practically behind you).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Russell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, definitely not gym quality
customer_reviews.text: Took my time installing by myself and it took about 2 hours. Moving it around is easy, it can go almost completely vertical and it fits through doorways easily even completely assembled. The box came in pretty bad shape and the styrofoam inside was crumbled, but after inspecting everything, it all came out ok. Lots of plastic parts so ill come back in 6 months with an update on whether it falls apart or not.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: works good. one complaint is as others have said
customer_reviews.text: bike arrived undamaged. took about an hour to put it together. works good. one complaint is as others have said. you can't read the screen very good because there is no light in it. Also the hand grips for the heart rate won't work unless i get my hands wet. don't like going to the kitchen to run water over my hands before using the bike. Also my feet don't point straight ahead so my heals hit the arm the pedals are on so i can't use the foot straps and have to keep my feet hanging half way off the pedals. i guess i'll try and find some wider pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and convience.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. My husband assembled it in approx. 3 hours. He only requested my assistance when he accidently dropped the screws inside. His hand was too big🙂. The chairseat is comfortable. It makes me want to ride longer. We placed an exercise mat on our hardwood floors and its perfect. I love that its quiet and sturdy. I'm still trying to figure out all the buttons, but for now the "quick" button works. I love the fan too. This investment gives you piece of mind to not worry about leaving the house to get a workout. You can enjoy your private workout in the comfort of your home on your Nautilus Recumbent bike.
customer_reviews.author: R.Baker

customer_reviews.title: i feel im on the road again
customer_reviews.text: After a total hip replacement after an accident I wasn't able to ride my bike. The drs had promised I would but it never happened. During my Rehabilitation the PT asked if I wanted ti try the recumbent bike. I was so nervous. I actually sat and biked slowly for ten minutes. When I was discharged my husband started looking for one on amazon. We found this one. Great price. Comfortable. I can put my reader up, magazine etc. The pocket on the left side is great for my water bottle and remote. The chair very comfortable. Love the screen. I would highly recommend this bike. Arrived on date promised. Very well packaged. Highly recommend this seller
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Nautilus Is Excellent Bike
customer_reviews.text: The Nautilus is an excellent buy and pretty much quality materials. It took longer to assemble it as the bolts and their receiving threads are a bit rough. This probably doubled the assembly time. The assembly manual could be better written as well. The bike as a whole is a great deal and with 15 miles on it is working will. Will proved a follow up review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: bama1255

customer_reviews.title: Important bike features.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product so far. Seat back design cpuld be improved by reshaping tbe seat. Although sturdy, seat struts and support bar should be. A heavier duty design. Computer controll are nice but need to manually learn. Instruction on contrpller use are poor but can be overcome. Multiuser tracker is nice feature. Should have bluetooth sync to external speakers. Smart tracker through app is ni e but shpuld sync to fitbit and other apps for data transfer. Plastic housimg arpund the mechanism is cheap but the flywheel apparatus that provudes resistance seems pretty well made.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good Exercise Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this exercise bike for roughly 8 months. I am really happy with this purchase. As some have said, the packaging is a little poor. My box arrived torn and with large holes in it. Luckily everything was there. One of the plates that the base mounts onto was bent. I found it was easy to straighten so no problem. My only complaint is the my butt starts to hurt after 40 or 45 minutes. I usually ride for at least an hour so the last part of my ride is usually pretty uncomfortable. I am looking into a seat pad. In spite of the hard seat I really like the bike and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: User's Manual Lacking Details
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to have detailed pictures of the console, troubleshooting hints, etc. in the User's Manual. Nope. Not there. I had to search the web to find a manual with details (the manual I got with the bike was #8016280.080118.B, the detailed manual was #8016282.080118.B). During assembly, I had problems with the flimsy plastic connectors making contact within the console mast. Gulp... no power. I disassembled the mast and reseated the connectors. Voila, power! Mind you this was my problem, not Nautilus's. Overall, I'm happy with the bike and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement bile for one that finally algave out after a decade. Seat slides easily and the usb port is a Welcome addition. Only concern is that the angle on the seat puts a bit more strain on the knees than out prior recumbent bike.
customer_reviews.author: B o

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth doesn't work properly. No software instruction manual.
customer_reviews.text: Bike is great but with confusing and non-existent connectivity it's very much like 1990's technology. The bike's hardware is not the issue, it's the missing instruction manual that describes how to use the bluetooth and software. Customer service is unavailable (hours of wait time and no response to emails) allegedly because of COVID-19, and the connectivity applications they ask users to download DO NOT EXIST for android or iphone. It's buyer beware and self-help.
customer_reviews.author: Film love

customer_reviews.title: Seat height hurts knees.  Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The product has good features but puts pressure on the knees causing pain and there is no way to change the seat height. Tried to reach customer service several times; sent emails and called but the message said waiting times were over an hour. If they valued their customers they would respond to emails and hire more people to address the call volume. Very disappointed. Was looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack C.

customer_reviews.title: Day 5 and already a stronger heart!!
customer_reviews.text: $50 rebate/cheaper than it’s Schwinn cousin (they have the same computer). My 14 year old assembled it. Good iPhone app for tracking your progress/goals.. Absolutely get a polar T31 non coded heart monitor with it!! Im a fatty (250+ pounds) and committed to 30 min a day. On day 5 I can already feel and see (on app log) my cardio improving - my working heart rate is falling (see photo)..
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Once its together its great
customer_reviews.text: Over all its a great bike, a little difficult to assemble (wiring was tough). Very little if no manual on how to configure the control panel, supposedly it will connect with bluetooth and stuff.. can't find anything on it and none of my tablets seem to know it is present. So that ride through the internet road .. was a lie. I peddle and my bike just sits there in front of the window. Probably should have sprung for the nordic track
customer_reviews.author: Brent C. Kirkley

customer_reviews.title: Just really disappointed since my husband needs this for his PD therapy
customer_reviews.text: This item was dumped at a locked building anyone could have taken. Also have been dealing with Nautilus for 3 weeks to get part since it came broken. Just a big headache and probably will never order a big ticket item from Amazon again. Just really disappointed since my husband needs this for his PD therapy.
customer_reviews.author: camping Ma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - good price - be patient during assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice recumbent bike at an excellent price. The display is not as fancy as some others, but we don't care about that. We just want to be able to get a good aerobic ride at home. It's not hard to put together, but it does require patience as some of the assembly is a little tedious. When attaching the display module, have a second person available to help hold it while you wrangle the cords into place. This is my second time assembling a recumbent bike. It took me about 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, quality bike but requires power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. I am still trying to figure out the console user interface -- they need to hire a human factors engineer to make a better interface. Also, I was surprised that I had to supple A/C power -- my previous stationary bike received sufficient power from me pedaling. Anyway -- I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne O. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Love my bike!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this bike. I had two torn meniscus knees and was having trouble getting my motion back after surgery. I set this up in my garage and go out in the morning in my pajamas, set my ipad on the built in tray, plug it in to the speakers, turn on the fan and it is a pleasure to work out. Also, it was really easy to assemble the hardest part was getting it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to avoid it from happening
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely quiet. Took about an hour to put together with help. After a week of use for 2 people we’ve put on 90 miles and it is still quiet. Quick tip, some have reported a “clunk”. That noise is coming from the pedal. An easy way to avoid it from happening, is to add some plumbers tape to the threads before screwing the pedals on.
customer_reviews.author: John silvers

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike
customer_reviews.text: Over I am very satisfied with the Nautilus Recumbent Bike. The only minor difficulty was in learning after having installed the display, which was almost the last of the parts to be assembled, I didn't have to struggle so hard to dress the upper cables. It was not immediately obvious that the connectors would be covered by the console pivote shroud .
customer_reviews.author: Emiko McNair

customer_reviews.title: Terrible workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Wiring harness looked like assembled by an incompetent!! After completely assembled, notice the console looked like it was one returned as it had sticky tape and the wires were broken . Took on hold with Nautilus for 30 minutes, had to send pictures etc, and now wait probably 2 weeks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith a. Mallatt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Product was damaged upon arrival. You can see where the box had been opened before. I’m guessing it was a return. The electronics worked intermittently, you couldn’t adjust the tension, the fan didn’t work. I inspected all the plugs and they were connected. It just didn’t work. Very disappointed. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Les F

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: What a great way to stay in shape during the CORONAVIRUS Pandemic. Listen to an audio book, any time of day or night, best of all it is exceptionally quiet. I don't know why it took me so long to get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: The McDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Well I’m on this every day for an hour. I’ve lost weight. It’s nice and smooth. Professional feeling. Assembly was easy enough. I did it myself but followed directions exactly. Like how it moves way down for short people. My 11 yr old, 4,10” can use it easily.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Really well built bike with good features but heartbeat feature doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried getting the heartbeat feature to work. Product support at Nautilus was excellent and set me a replacement console and contact handlebars. But it didn't work. Heartbeat reads erratically high. Tried all suggestions but to no avail. Still worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Edison

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about it
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it. I had the expert assemble it (recommended) and it is everything I hoped it would be. It does everything it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for about 18 mo now. and paid for assembly. It’s sturdy, reliable and a great entry model, although I don’t see a need to “upgrade” to anything else either, this does the job! Nautilus has been a pleasure to deal with and I’m quite happy with my bike. I use it to keep my ROM and mobility/cardio up to par.
customer_reviews.author: DogsRFamily

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed that the bike arrived in 3 days. It took about 40 minutes to get it out of the box and assembled. Quiet and easy to program, easy to mount and dismount. The bike itself is sturdy with no wobble while riding and the seat is very easy to adjust. I have had a cheaper bike but it was far inferior to the quality of this one. Well worth the price considering it seems to be the same model as the Schwinn 230 yet costs less.
customer_reviews.author: Highland Croft

customer_reviews.title: Bike great, delivery terrible- harmed product
customer_reviews.text: Well, product seems wonderful and was fairly easily put together. However, when it was delivered the box was so destroyed they had damaged areas of the bike. I had to reconnect the wheel area as they had damaged it so much during delivery. Almost had to return it but I was able to adjust it and it’s working.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, we got a dud!
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke quickly, yet just out of warranty, and wasn't used all that much. $180 to replace the console panel. Not a fun experience.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Sales

customer_reviews.title: NO INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! VERY LIMITED OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS. SUPPOSED TO HAVE MANY, MANY FEATURES...BUT HOWDO I ACCESS THEM???? E-MAILED NAUTILUS DIRECTLY...NO REPLY
customer_reviews.author: fightingterp

customer_reviews.title: Solid exercise bike with many great features
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I like everything about this bike except that we find the seat adjustment difficult. We are both in our 70's and have to bend over to peer under the seat to see the the positioning guide, and then move the seat to that position without overshooting or undershooting the location. It is not a smooth transition between positions. Except for this one issue, the bike has many great features, including quiet operation, tracking our workouts, ease of adjusting intensity, built-in programs, and a 3-speed fan in the console. We haven't tried the online app yet.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable tu use.
customer_reviews.text: Seat comfort and adjustability good. Seems sturdy , had for two months . Handles up to almost 300 lbs well. Two people use. Registers distance, time and speed plus pulse. Tried to set up the multiple user settings but did not save. Or we haven’t read the instructions well enough to keep setting. Only down side so far is info panel hard to read, does not light up.well review more in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: madcook!

customer_reviews.title: Quiet bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike replaces an old secondhand noisy bike that my wife bought to continue her physical therapy. This bike is solid and quiet enough to watch TV at normal volume. We tried another bike but the the seat could not be adjusted for her short legs. This bike has more than enough seat adjustment. The seat is comfortable and the adjustable back helps with limited flexibility. Like many things these days, the owners manual gave good assembly instruction but stopped short of how to program a workout - "there's an app for that". I would recommend the bike: I've even started using it myself.
customer_reviews.author: John Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Great machine at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product that seems very sturdy and should last a long time. Controls are intuitive and assembly was reasonable. Only negative I found was that the seat release is difficult and finding and reengaging the seat into a stop is tricky. That mechanism should be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Apps for Android don't work. Instructions for assembly and operation are really bad. No support.
customer_reviews.text: No app for Android. Cannot connect to anything with Bluetooth without app. Product description contains false and misleading information. Instructions for assembly and operation are really bad. Seat is hard as a rock. This bike was oversold and is not worth the price I paid. It seems to be an old model. No customer service.
customer_reviews.author: TBWilson

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good quality recumbent bike...
customer_reviews.text: Recumbent bike works as expected. New at this, so monitor screen and button panel options are a bit difficult to figure out. Still can’t figure out how to use the ride along feature, after downloading the app to my iPad from internet. Good bike however. Assembly was fairly simple.
customer_reviews.author: O'Irish

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and sturdy bike.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid build. Excellent quality SS hardware. Assembly was quick and easy because part alignments were perfect and much pre-assembly of sub-components was performed at the factory. Sturdy bike with smooth operation. The electronic component worked without any fuss and was fairly intuitive. Took off one star due to the unreliable heart monitor which seems to work only half the time and requires a firm squeeze to get a reading, however this function is not of particular importance to us.
customer_reviews.author: StratosC

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great product. Easy to assemble and move around once together. Wife has no complaints and uses it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps not to accept torn pkgs.
customer_reviews.text: When the pkg. arrived the box was torn badly.On Aug. the 20th we opened the box and found 3 pieces missing. I bought the bike to help me shape up before going to Florida in November, we'll see how fast I get the parts, hopefully soon. I feel once its together I'll really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Maples

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: After a long research period we decided to go with this bike, I was hurt and gained over 100 lbs, this bike held my 322lbs with ease,bike is used daily and still 6 months later we had no problens. I LOVE this bike,does everything we want and very easy to operate. Ergonomic and phenomenal price! We looked at 17 different bikes..very happy we bought the Nautilus.. you will be too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't quite as easy to put together as it said in the reviews, but not too bad either. The only complaint I have is that the instruction book that came with it was not complete, but I went online and printed off the eight pages that had been left off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, wide seat!
customer_reviews.text: This bike does what it's supposed to. I'm 55 and the thought of a skinny bike seat was painful. I've used recumbent bikes at PT and they were great, I replaced my old treadmill with this bike. It's so much lighter to move and the features are good. Assembly wasn't horrendous, just took a bit of time. The seat adjustment took a bit of getting used to but we've been using it for a month now and like all new things, it takes some getting used to. It works for my husband and I.
customer_reviews.author: jacksongirl

customer_reviews.title: Poor Display, Above Average Mechanicals
customer_reviews.text: A marginal display cripples this machine. It's hard to set up, difficult to use, and far from accurate. The mechanicals are good with comfortable seating, but the seat lock requires more force than one would think necessary to secure. My previous Nordic Track 500 series was a much better value.
customer_reviews.author: David Pulkrabek

customer_reviews.title: One major flaw
customer_reviews.text: The bike is nice. It works well, has a lot of options and the iOS app support is pretty good. The big issue is the seat. It is isn't deep enough. I keep sliding within the seat and find it uncomfortable because it needs to be deeper.
customer_reviews.author: BackupGeek

customer_reviews.title: Seat back
customer_reviews.text: Love, love the bike! It actually took my husband and I only 1 1/2 hr. to put together. It is rather heavy to carry for one person. We had to ask a neighbor to help. A plus for this bike is the seat back, so comfortable! If you have back problems a seat back is a must on a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike was easy to assemble by my 29 year old son. Everything works, so far mo issues. I’ve used the bike four times so far for thirty minutes each and I’ve loved every minute of it. I feel the bike is a great buy for the amount that I have paid!
customer_reviews.author: Petra LaForest

customer_reviews.title: Solid Exercise for Moderate Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for second home. Been very reliable so far. Seat is hard, but with a cushion comfortable to ride for an hour. Not sure how well it would last under daily use by multiple riders for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: circuitbored

customer_reviews.title: shippers did horrible job.
customer_reviews.text: Box ripped apart and Styrofoam crushed. No idea if bike is OK.
customer_reviews.author: J.T. Woolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with our exercise bike purchase. We were happily surprised that all parts were included, they all fit together easily, and the bike is sturdy. The assembly directions could have been a little more explicit with larger diagrams and having some of the steps broken up since there were multiple things that had to be done in each step, but overall we (being very unskilled as these type of assemblies) managed to piece it all together.
customer_reviews.author: Martha P. Mendonca

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase. Easy to assemble. I use five days a week and there is enough variation of program to not get bored. It is VERY quiet. My husband can watch TV with me on the bike about 12 feet away and he cannot hear the bike at all. When it first arrived one of the cables was not fitting. I called the manufacturer who shipped me a replacement at no cost. Their customer service was great. The cost thru Amazon was better than what we found locally, and we have a better product as well.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Maglione

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, solid construction, works well.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, solid construction, feels well made. The easy to use lit up display provides plenty of exercise programs and information. The fan is a nice addition as well. I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Robert Yarnold

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to my fittness pal as advertised
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I bought this bike was because it says one can connect to “my fitness pal”. It seems this is not true and very disappointing. I like the bike otherwise but that was a selling point for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hauge

customer_reviews.title: Not what was expected
customer_reviews.text: The Nautilus R18 is the top end premium recumbent bike in its class. That is what I expected to receive. Instead I received a used bike. There were many worn spots and touched up scratches. Although I was provided a credit after I notified Amazon of the issue, the credit wasn't as much as I wanted. They did offer to let me return it but I had already spent 3 hours assembling the bike and the packaging was destroyed when removing the parts.
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike for the price. I am 5' 10" 240 lbs. The little woman is 4' 9" 120 lbs. The bike is easily adjusted for either of us. It has 2 user settings, so we can each track our progress. It does not have bluetooth or a color screen with some idiot urging you on. It does have a number of preset programs and a place to program a custom workout of your own. The fan is better than I expected. It is super quiet. I'm glad I went with the recumbent style instead of getting a new treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jung

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Really comfy seat, I sometimes just sit on it and watch tv. My husband wanted tuis item and we put it together with little issue. It is excellent quality and ebcourages exercise with roomy, well shaped seat and large monitor for watching stats.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C

customer_reviews.title: Not looking good.
customer_reviews.text: The box was almost shredded when it was dropped off, the inside of the bike was scratched and had small dents on the side. Not the kind of state I was hoping to find a $400+ purchase. I hope it starts when I turn it on....
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: It works and you are not at a gym
customer_reviews.text: I did have another set it up and it took about an hour but not problematic. The machine seems to work well and I am happy other than it does need to be leveled a small degree or two, I think..
customer_reviews.author: Denise Newcomer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice recumbent bike. Sturdy and fairly comfortable. More than enough settings and seat adjustments. Assembly was tedious but straightforward Cons: fan never worked and heart monitor is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: There are definitely less expensive models available. This model is very sturdy and well made it will last. It was easy to assemble (about 40 min) not as good as a gym model but close.
customer_reviews.author: Louneson

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet - Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get an exercise machine that was easy on the joints. This definitely fit the bill. Great price, easy to put together. Lots of options, multiple user. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl murnane

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate sensors in hand grips seldom work
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, I like everything about it except the heart rate sensors built into the lower hand grips, what a big bunch of junk! Hard to get them to work.... if at all. Its difficult to believe that Nautilus would think they were perfectly fine, work fine and up to their standards. The sensors keep a good machine from being a great machine!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality recumbent bike good value !
customer_reviews.text: R614 - Great recumbent bike. Easy assembly and very sturdy. Arrived quickly good value. Very quiet smooth operation - more than enough programs and levels of effort to satisfy most exercise addicts.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin I. Medley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value for a recumbent bike
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT right out of the box! Box arrived via UPS a little beat up but packaging inside kept unit damage free ( luckily) Started daily rides to get back in shape- smooth and quiet only thing I wish they did was put the AC adapter in the rear or side of bike- It's located in the front of unit and hard to hide ( so I unplug after each use) Fan works great and its easy to program and use overall. I didn't assemble since I had hubby do it- so if I didn't have help that might have been intimidating!
customer_reviews.author: suzi

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Bluetooth App?
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically, good, technology, bad. The app they say to use in the manual does not exist, the Bluetooth does not connect, customer service is over an hour (they say), product registration is a difficult process. No onine forums, no online technical support. Not what I'd expect from a Portland based compny.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Regula

customer_reviews.title: Nautilus R616 Recumbent Bike is fantastic for get back in shape after a major medical event
customer_reviews.text: My Nautilus is helping me get my body up and out of bed and back on the fishing bank. It is easy to use and it keeps record of what you and uo to 3 of your friend are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Les Keator

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, comfortable, and quiet. The two screens are helpful, and encourage you to finish the exercise by showing how far you went and how far you have to go. It would be nice if it displayed more parameters at one time, such as time and level and distance. The directions aren't that great, but by calling the helpline (they didn't know all the details, either) and reading the manual and thinking about it, I have it figured out well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mendi

customer_reviews.title: Cool bike
customer_reviews.text: It was easy yo put together. It replaces one that was worn out. It has a very comfy seat that s easily adjustable and the fan works. Still get very hot but the fan is nice
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seat Assembly
customer_reviews.text: After assembling the bike, whenever I leaned back on the chair it squeaked. Drove me crazy. Followed all the problem determination recommendations and made sure all hardware was tight. The machine still made noise. However, since my sister had one and it was quiet I figured it had to be problem with the seat assembly. I called the manufacturer as stated in the assembly instructions and they sent me out a new assembly right away. I also requested a whole new set of hardware since mine were pretty stripped after trying to tighten. After installing the new seat assembly my bike is now super quiet. I really love this machine. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: laurencewolf

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY EXERCISER !
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike already. I had it put together in an hour and without any problems. All nuts, bolts. washers etc. were there. If you want to learn how to operate the programs, you have to go to the website for the info. I have no negative comments. Packaging was unbelievable! Every part was wrapped in its own protective bag and in pristine shape upon arrival
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for an exercise bike and finally decided on this one based on other reviews. I found that Amazon had the best price and was able to deliver it for free within two days. I'm very happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Longputt

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: The only thing this bike lacks is a short video to show the proper use of the computer. Still, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT WICKES

customer_reviews.title: I absolute am in love with this bike
customer_reviews.text: I absolute am in love with this bike! I believe I got it in about 24 hours from ordering. Wasn't hard to put together. Nice and quiet so I can use while people are sleeping. Having the double screen is so nice and being able to connect a flash drive to save your previous workouts. Honestly the only negative thing I could say is my feet hit the bar occasionally but I just angle my feet slightly and I'm good
customer_reviews.author: Sissy Jean

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice bike. We didn't put it together.paid extra for that service
customer_reviews.author: Becky Preston

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Feels like the bike at the gym. We are choosing not to go to the gym during the pandemic . It’s sturdy , not noisy , but not as easy to assemble as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

product_meta.title: Nautilus Recumbent Bike Series
feature_bullets: With enhanced Bluetooth connectivity, users can set, track and monitor progress with popular app based tracking tools
Dimensions: 65.3" L x 28.3" W x 49.6" H | Product Weight: 91.9 lbs

Access the Explore the World app and digitally immerse yourself in a world of virtual courses, exotic locales, and stunning trails from around the globe, 3 free courses available; Unlock more with Explore the World app subscription
DualTrack blue backlit LCD console displays 29 customizable workout programs
25 levels of resistance for a wide range of workout intensity options
Padded seat with ventilated back on sliding seat rail for adjustable comfort

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
